title: 2020 Ford Mustang Bullitt for Sale with Just 1,200 Miles

title: Volvo CEO: Cars Will Be Fully Electric Within 10 Years
description: It's been a little over four years since Volvo announced that it would go all-electric by the end of the decade, but the Swedish automaker has already changed its plans. Volvo is now aiming for a mix of all-electric and plug-in hybrid models to comprise 90%-100% of its sales by that time, but its ...

descriptionSummary: Volvo's ambitious electric transition plan is shifting gears. Originally set to be fully electrified by the end of the decade, the Swedish automaker now plans for a portfolio of electric and plug-in hybrids to make up 90-100% of its lineup.

title: 2026 Mercedes-Benz Lineup: New CLA, Maybach SL, AMG E 53 Wagon arrive
description: Mercedes-Benz enters the 2026 model year with basically the same lineup for 2025, but with a few notable additions, particularly on the entry-level end. title: Shell is working on a way to make EV charging faster
description: Shell may be one of the world's largest oil companies, but it also operates a global network of EV charging stations—and it's researching ways to charge cars faster. According to Top Gear, Shell is working with the RML Group—a U.K. motorsports and engineering company whose other projects include a ...

title: Audi RS6 Avant Isn’t Escaping the Split Headlight Craze
description: Split headlights have quickly become one of the defining design trends of the past few years, showing up on everything from budget crossovers to high-performance machines. The idea is usually to separate the daytime running lights from the main beams, creating a layered or stacked look – an ...
titleSummary: Audi's Luxurious Wagon Takes a Stylish Leap into Controversial Design Territory
descriptionSummary: Dual-beam headlight designs are now a hallmark of modern automotive styling, appearing on both economy-friendly crossovers and high-powered sports cars alike. This distinctive layout separates low-beam and high-beam functions for a sleek, multi-layered effect.

title: From Vacuums to Bugattis? Dreame’s First Car Render Raises Eyebrows
description: Dreame Auto, the car-making arm of Dreame Technology, has been promising something outrageous ever since it announced plans to enter the EV market. titleSummary: Dreame's Futuristic Leap: Vacuum Maker Tries Its Hand at High-Octane Design
descriptionSummary: Dreame Auto, a subsidiary of Dreame Technology, is making waves with ambitious plans to electrify the automotive scene. The tech giant behind innovative cleaning solutions and precision motors is shifting gears towards high-performance electric vehicles.

title: Mercedes-Benz Kills EQ Branding, Will Just Call EVs “Electric”
description: Speaking to media at the IAA Mobility show in Munich this week, Mercedes-Benz CEO Markus Schäfer confirmed the brand would be ditching its "EQ" moniker currently used for EVs. The automaker has stated that the name is functionally dead, and no further models, like the EQS, using that ...

descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz CEO Markus Schäfer revealed at IAA Mobility in Munich this week that the company will retire its "EQ" branding for electric vehicles, deeming it a redundant label after the latest model launch.

title: Mercedes’ New AMG E53 Hybrid Wagon Underprices Its German Rivals By a Lot
description: Back in April, Mercedes-Benz surprised its American fans with the debut of the AMG E53 Hybrid Wagon. It marked the arrival of a proper low-slung performance wagon to the brand's US lineup, not the lifted crossover with wagon-like pretensions that America currently has. The model was introduced as a ...

descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz shook up its American market this spring by unveiling the AMG E53 Hybrid Wagon. This sleek, high-performance estate car finally brings a genuine alternative to the lifted crossovers posing as wagons in the US lineup.

title: 2026 Toyota Land Cruiser Pricing Barely Rises, But Discounts Favor 2025
description: The Land Cruiser's return to the US has been nothing short of successful. After re-entering the market as a boxy, slightly smaller alternative to the full-fat LC, the SUV has quickly proven its appeal. Toyota sold 27,336 units during the first half of 2025, compared to just 3,461 in the same period ...

descriptionSummary: Following its highly anticipated return to the US market, the Land Cruiser has seen a remarkable resurgence in popularity. The rugged SUV's unique charm and more compact size have captivated buyers, with sales surging to 27,336 units in the first half of 2025.

title: Is This the 2026 Nissan Sentra's New Design?
description: Nissan sedans, such as the Sentra and Versa in America, have leaned heavily on the current V-Motion grille, first previewed by the Vmotion 2.0 concept in 2017. title: How $1.58 Billion of Tariff Pain is Forcing Mazda to Abandon Small Cars for Big SUVs
description: Much like other automakers, Mazda is navigating one of the trickiest periods in its U.S. history. Despite having more sales than ever, tariffs on imported vehicles have forced the Japanese brand to rethink its lineup, pricing, and production strategies. Mazda projects tariffs will cost $1.58 ...

descriptionSummary: Mazda finds itself at a critical juncture in the US market, where rising import tariffs are disrupting long-held business plans. As sales reach record highs, the company is reassessing its product offerings, price points, and manufacturing strategies to mitigate the financial blow.

title: Sorry Tesla, Lyft Is Deploying Its Own Robotaxis
description: For years, Tesla has received considerable public and investor attention regarding the future of self-driving cars, promising services and software like Full Self-Driving and a full-on robotaxi service using bespoke Tesla vehicles, such as the sleek Cybertruck. descriptionSummary: Tesla's vision for autonomous transportation has been at the forefront of industry chatter, with promises of advanced driver-assist systems like Full Self-Driving and robotaxi services, potentially powered by futuristic vehicles like the Cybertruck.

description: We all know the Lamborghini Urus as one of the most aggressive-looking SUVs in the market today. title: Mercedes EQS Solid-State Prototype Covers 749 Miles on One Charge
description: Range anxiety may have just met its match. The achievement stands as one of the most impressive real-world ...

descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz has successfully pushed its electric EQS prototype to new limits, completing an 749-mile journey from Stuttgart to Malmö on a single charge using a groundbreaking solid-state battery that still had 85 miles of range left in reserve.

title: Jaguar Land Rover Data Breach: What Owners Need to Know
description: Last week, Jaguar Land Rover announced that a cyber attack had severely disrupted their operations. The company sent staff home while it investigated and paused operations following the attack. Now, the automaker says it believes that some customer data may have been affected by the attack. "As a ...

descriptionSummary: Jaguar Land Rover recently suffered a significant cyber attack that forced them to shut down operations and send employees home pending an investigation. The company now suspects that sensitive customer information may have been compromised in the breach.

It builds on the brand's reputation for combining track-focused engineering with day-to-day usability, offering agility thanks to its carbon fiber Monocage II chassis and ...
titleSummary: McLaren Unveils Limited-Edition 750S Tribute to Japan's Legendary Racing Heritage
descriptionSummary: The McLaren 750S crowns the manufacturer's lineup, blending razor-sharp performance with everyday practicality. Its ultra-lightweight carbon fiber construction and advanced chassis make it a formidable force on both the track and the road.

title: Honda’s 2026 Ridgeline Arrives, but 2025 Models Offer Better Value

descriptionSummary: Two decades ago, Honda disrupted the midsize truck market with the introduction of its first Ridgeline in 2005. Unlike traditional rivals, it employed a innovative unibody design for a more refined driving experience.

descriptionSummary: A significant portion of car image search results are dominated by artificially generated pictures. While searching on Google Images or similar platforms, many results display telltale signs of AI-rendering, often with a distinct yellow tone.

description: General Motors announced this week that it will scale back production of both the Cadillac Lyriq and Vistiq in addition to the upcoming Chevrolet Bolt EV. descriptionSummary: General Motors has announced plans to reduce production on several electric vehicle models, including the Cadillac Lyriq and Vistiq, as well as the upcoming Chevrolet Bolt EV. The decision comes ahead of a federal tax credit expiration that could slow down EV sales.

title: Volkswagen Cutting a Deal With Trump: Spend $10 Billion to Save Billions
description: Volkswagen is reportedly close to striking a deal with the Trump administration that would see the German automaker invest billions in U.S. operations in exchange for relief from punishing tariffs. The company is proposing a minimum of $10 billion investment in exchange for lower tariffs.  The ...

descriptionSummary: Volkswagen is on the verge of a major agreement with the US government, involving a significant investment in American facilities in exchange for reduced tariffs. The deal could see VW commit at least $10 billion to local operations.

title: Porsche's Carbon Fiber Windshield Wipers Are A Stupid Expensive Option No One Needs

This monumental project will revolutionize the production of America's most extreme high-performance vehicles. With a legacy spanning over 20 years, Hennessey continues to push the boundaries of speed and innovation.

descriptionSummary: The Nissan Skyline GT-R has long been a holy grail for enthusiasts, with the R32 model standing out as a particularly coveted gem. Its reputation as "Godzilla" is well-deserved, having redefined Japanese performance standards in the 90s and beyond.

title: Ford Launches First Global Marketing Push in a Decade With “Ready Set Ford”
description: The auto industry is going through massive changes, with new technology, new products and new competitors and, “there’s a belief not all brands are going to survive this transformation,” said Ford’s Chief Marketing Officer Lisa Materazzo. That’s why she and her team have decided it’s time for the ...

descriptionSummary: The automotive landscape is undergoing a profound shift, driven by rapid technological advancements and emerging players. According to Ford's CMO Lisa Materazzo, only some brands will weather this transformation. Her team has recognized the need to adapt and evolve accordingly.

title: Kia Posts Best Sales Month Ever, More Than 80,000 Vehicles Sold
description: High vehicle prices and tightening consumer wallets have put the automotive industry on the edge of a potential downturn, but Kia is defying the odds. The South Korean manufacturer posted its best sales month ever this past August, with more than 80,000 vehicles sold for the first time in its ...
titleSummary: Kia Sets New Records with Record-Breaking August Sales Surge
descriptionSummary: Despite an otherwise sluggish market, Kia bucked the trend with a record-breaking sales month in August, selling over 80,000 vehicles and demonstrating resilience in the face of high vehicle prices and cautious consumer spending.

title: Mercedes CEO: The V12 Isn’t Dead Yet — It’s Staying “Into the 2030s”
description: "I will not say more, but it's coming," Mercedes-Benz CEO Thomas Schäfer told Autocar. Mercedes-Benz confirmed it will keep its big V12 engine in production "into the 2030s" today at the IAA Mobility show in Munich. It appears Mercedes has found a way around looming Euro 7 emissions ...

descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz CEO Thomas Schäfer hinted at an important announcement, but remained tight-lipped about specifics. At the IAA Mobility show, the automaker confirmed it will continue producing its powerful V12 engine until at least the 2030s, potentially circumventing looming Euro 7 emissions regulations.

description: BMW isn’t slowing down. By 2028, the Bavarian automaker says it will bring more than 40 new or heavily updated models to market, each designed with its own distinct look rather than a cookie-cutter family resemblance. The strategy rides on the launch of the Neue Klasse platform, the flexible ...
titleSummary: "BMW's Ambitious Expansion: 40 Game-Changing Cars to Hit Roads by 2028"
descriptionSummary: BMW is accelerating its product lineup, planning to introduce over 40 new and revamped models by 2028. Each vehicle will showcase unique design, breaking away from a uniform aesthetic in favor of individual character. This shift is driven by the Neue Klasse platform's versatility.

title: Audi RS3 Five-Cylinder Hot Hatch to End in 2026 as EV Era Nears
description: The days of Audi’s raucous five-cylinder engine are numbered. The RS3, the last car in Audi’s lineup to carry the unique 2.5-liter turbocharged unit, has about two years left before stricter European emissions rules force its retirement. For enthusiasts, it is a real gut punch, since the offbeat ...

descriptionSummary: Audi's iconic five-cylinder engine is nearing its expiration date. With new EU emissions regulations looming, the RS3's potent 2.5-liter turbocharged unit will soon be phased out, leaving fans to bid farewell to this distinctive sound and character.

description: The idea of a smaller Mercedes-Benz G-Class has been an open secret for the German marque. Often referred to as the "Baby G" or "Mini G," the model is expected to arrive within the next two years as the entry point into an expanding G-Class range. It aligns with Mercedes' intention to evolve "G" ...

descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz has long hinted at a more compact take on its iconic G-Class, colloquially dubbed the "Baby G." This newcomer is expected to debut within the next two years as an entry-level offering in the expanding G-Class lineup.

title: Dodge Charger Daytona and Jeep Wagoneer S EVs for Rollaway Risk
description: A parking gear is supposed to be the least dramatic part of a car. But Stellantis has discovered that, in some of its newest EVs, it isn’t doing its job. The automaker is recalling a small batch of Dodge Charger Daytona and Jeep Wagoneer S EVs after finding that they could roll away even when ...
titleSummary: "Electric Chargers and Wagoneers Face Recalls Over Spontaneous Gear Shifts"
descriptionSummary: A seemingly mundane aspect of car ownership has taken an unexpected turn for Stellantis, whose latest electric vehicles are experiencing a parking gear malfunction that allows them to roll away unexpectedly. A recall is underway for certain Dodge and Jeep models.

title: 2026 Nissan Z Pays Tribute to Godzilla Legacy
description: After an 18-year production run that saw nearly 48,000 units sold globally, the final Nissan GT-R R35 rolled out of its production plant in Japan last month. It was emotional for enthusiasts, even for Nissan, which released a tribute video for the R35 as the company closes its chapter. Despite ...
titleSummary: "Zilla's Legacy Lives On: Nissan Unveils Reborn Sports Car Inspired by Iconic Beast"
descriptionSummary: The curtain has closed on the iconic Nissan GT-R R35's 18-year run, with nearly 48,000 units sold worldwide before its final departure from Japan's production lines last month. A poignant end to an era, indeed.

title: Honda Prelude’s First Batch Gone in a Flash
description: Once a staple in Honda's lineup throughout the 1980s and 1990s, the Prelude was known for its balanced dynamics and understated styling before bowing out in the early 2000s. Its comeback finally went official last week, both in Japan and the US, when the new coupe was unveiled as a production ...
titleSummary: "Prelude to Chaos: Honda's Sought-After Model Sells Out in Record Time"
